This suggests that applying the SSE threshold can effectively exclude the cases in which the latent heat significantly changes the apparent thermal diffusivity. Note that some site-depths have high SSE values (and thus were excluded) even though they are less affected by soil freezing/thawing (Supplementary Fig. 19a), probably because the other conditions for the validity of Eq. ( 4) are not met, e.g., the diffusivity varies too much over the year or along the considered depth interval, or the surface soil temperature itself does not conform to a sine-wave (due to, e.g., a non-sine shaped air temperature, or a strong winter insulation of snow causing asymmetric effects on the seasonal-cycle).
